results.title: How do you read? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Harris Watts, Stephen Rose and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Being unable to read is a personal disaster. Learning to read at an early age is very important. This film demonstrates various modern techniques and devices used to increase reading speed, and it shows that the speed of reading and the rate of comprehension are related to the material being studied.

results.title: The Hot-blooded dinosaurs
results.creator_credit: Robin Bates, Robin Brightwell, WGBH (Boston) and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Challenges our conventional ideas of dinosaurs. Argues that they were not slow-moving, cold blooded reptiles, but were agile, intelligent and hot-blooded. Points out that they didn’t all die out and that their descendants are alive and well and living all around us.

results.title: Goodbye Gutenberg
results.creator_credit: Edward Goldwyn, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Printed work is our main method of storing, retrieving and transmitting information, but the tiny electronic pulses in computers today are about to change that. Electronic text means words being stored, displayed, restored or sent around the world. The changes this could cause are discussed. Presented by Anthony Smith.

results.title: A Naive country kid
results.brief_description:
At 17 Greg joined the air force and his role would be to give the aircraft the best chance of surviving a crash. Two years after joining up, Greg was sent to Thailand and one particular aircraft rescue would change his outlook on life forever.
Called out to an aircraft crash to help the Americans contain a huge fire, the Aussies were unaware where the aircraft had come from. After the flames were put out, Greg would realise this was a Thai plane that he had flown on many times. The memory of this day would stay with him all his life.
results.description:

Called out to an aircraft crash to help the Americans contain a huge fire, the Aussies were unaware where the aircraft had come from. After the flames were put out, Greg would realise this was a Thai plane that he had flown on many times. The memory of this day would stay with him all his life.

results.title: An Airman at sea
results.brief_description: As Keith flew from Townsville to Milne Bay in Papua New Guinea, he wondered if he would ever see the shores of Australia again. Suffering from dengue fever, Keith battled illness the whole time. He made it back when the war ended and would go on to serve in the RAFF for 20 years.
results.description: As Keith flew from Townsville to Milne Bay in Papua New Guinea, he wondered if he would ever see the shores of Australia again. Suffering from dengue fever, Keith battled illness the whole time. He made it back when the war ended and would go on to serve in the RAFF for 20 years.

results.title: Solving work problems
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Peter Quarry introduces a 3 step process for discussing poor work performance with staff. Discusses real life examples of common mistakes together with the correct way to counsel staff.
results.description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Peter Quarry introduces a 3 step process for discussing poor work performance with staff. Discusses real life examples of common mistakes together with the correct way to counsel staff.

results.title: Walk - Walk - Walk
results.brief_description: In 1966 Paul was playing in a band, ‘The Castaways’, the next minute he was conscripted to service in Vietnam. When Paul arrived in Vietnam he was told, “You’re in the infantry now, you will walk, and walk, and walk some more. You had to keep on moving, that was how you got through.”
results.description: In 1966 Paul was playing in a band, ‘The Castaways’, the next minute he was conscripted to service in Vietnam. When Paul arrived in Vietnam he was told, “You’re in the infantry now, you will walk, and walk, and walk some more. You had to keep on moving, that was how you got through.”
description_for_label: In 1966 Paul was playing in a band, ‘The Castaways’, the next minute he was conscripted to service in Vietnam. When Paul arrived in Vietnam he was told, “You’re in the infantry now, you will walk, and walk, and walk some more. You had to keep on moving, that was how you got through.”

results.title: Genesis (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
A joint British/US program unravelling the mysteries of nature. Genesis journeys through the world of embryology to discover the intricate mechanisms by which all animal life, from insect to human, is formed.
